intro: Solanum globiferum, commonly known as the globe tomato, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It produces small, round, red fruits that resemble tiny tomatoes, typically measuring around 1–2 centimeters in diameter. The plant has hairy, oval-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits. The flowers are yellow with five petals and are followed by the characteristic globular fruits.
